body: LGTM and merge to master if no more discussions

@AhyoungRyu Thanks for the review. Great to see High chart working nicely.

A lot more improvements on Helium menu will be required, like search, grouping packages by type, package list sort, etc. I'd like to address further improvements on Helium menu in separate PR.

Thanks @1ambda for the fix. Thanks @zjffdu for reviewing and verifying.

It looks good to me, while it provides more consistent behavior between `PysparkInterpreter` and `SPARK_HOME/bin/pyspark`. Merge to master and branch-0.7 if no more comments.
@minahlee Okay, I will take look.

@jongyoul you are right, `-Pr` does nothing in `create_release.sh`, so I removed it in a97b5fe. I kept `-Pr` in `publish_release.sh` though for the one who uses zeppelin-zrinterpreter_2.1x.jar in maven central repo.
fixed
@cloverhearts update looks good to me.

Thanks for review and considering the side effect @minahlee :+1:  
You're right! I missed this option.

As your mention, I checked `ZEPPELIN_SERVER_CONTEXT_PATH` option.

**Test 1**. When I set `ZEPPELIN_SERVER_CONTEXT_PATH` to `home` and connect `web dev mode (localhost:9000/home)`, it is okay.
![z_icon_9000](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8110458/21917881/a8d76556-d98e-11e6-932e-eeac33965bd4.png)

**Test 2**. But, when I set `ZEPPELIN_SERVER_CONTEXT_PATH` to `home` and connect localhost:8080/home`, there is the problem :cry: 
![z_icon_8080](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8110458/21917775/b06b89f6-d98d-11e6-9075-98af39e98e9c.png)

I'll update it and inform to you after resolving this issue.
LGTM
@Leemoonsoo @jongyoul Any comments for this PR ?
merging if no more comment

LGTM
merging if no more comment
LGTM
ouch! thanks for fixing this. LGTM.
LGTM
Good!! LGTM
Merge to master and branch-0.7 if no more comments!

@Leemoonsoo , honestly speaking, I don't know. But I've tested this fix in very isolated env(docker) and it's fixes it. I'm not saying that it's strong argument to fix issue this way, but may be it can give you some clue

Tested and LGTM.
Thanks @cloverhearts for the fix.

Merging to master and branch-0.7 as a hotfix.
Good job! @Leemoonsoo
LGTM, I saw your description and it makes sense to me.
I'm not sure the code but idea looks good to me.
LGTM
LGTM, merging if there's no more discussion
I hit the same issue! Thanks for fixing.
Thanks for taking care. LGTM
ping @felixcheung @prabhjyotsingh CI failure is not relevant.
@Leemoonsoo Thanks for the quick review. Merge into both master and branch-0.7 if there are no more comments.

CI failures are irrelevant.
Merge to master and branch-0.7 if no more comments
hi - are we good with this change? @ejono it looks like CI tests running on Spark 2.1 is passing - is that what you are asking about?
@khalidhuseynov If you don't mind, could you help review this docs changes? :)

minor question. LGTM.
waiting to for check CI - merging if no more comments.
LGTM. Merge to branch-0.7, master if there is no discussion.
thanks for keeping docs uptodate, LGTM
@AhyoungRyu @khalidhuseynov Thanks! 😄
CI failure is irrelevant to this docs update. Merge into master and branch-0.7 if there are no more comments.
could you trigger CI again?
@zjffdu Do you mind to rebase again please? Let me merge once rebase is done.
I trigger the CI, but the last CI failure is not relevant. Because this PR only modify livy interpreter, other failure should be flaky test. Unfortunately we seems to have more and more flaky test :(
Ping?
Merging this if no more discussion.

@minahlee PR is rebased, CI failure is not relevant.
```
Failed tests: 
  InterpreterOutputChangeWatcherTest.test:95 expected:<1> but was:<2>
```
LGTM

@felixcheung, yes, I was referring to PySparkInterpreterTest.testCompletion, which I thought may have been broken in the new Spark 2.1 Travis CI profile because it was broken for that profile but not other profiles, and it was broken for me locally as well when using Spark 2.1. @zjffdu says that it is a flaky test though, so I have no concerns if that's the case.
Will merge it if there's no more discussion
Looks good

Thanks @ejono since that test is passing in Travis runs let's merge this then?
let us know if you see anything - appreciate your help.
LGTM and merge to master
ping @felixcheung
CI failed in Selenium test and it's irrelevant to this change. Will merge into master and branch-0.7 if there are no more comments on this.
Sure CI failure looks it is not relevant to this. LGTM!

That's flaky test, I see several times of `WelcomePageSuite` in CI failure.
@felixcheung @minahlee Could any of you help to merge it into branch-0.7 as well ? Since this is only livy interpreter specific, so I don't think it would affect the 0.7 release.
@felixcheung @minahlee , Sorry my mistake, It has been merged into branch-0.7. @minahlee I notice you make the jira fixversion as 0.8, I add 0.7 as well.
LGTM
LGTM. Since branch-0.7 is already created, shell we merge this guy asap?

Thanks @1ambda for taking a look.

Merge to master if no more discussions. I'd like to backport this fix to branch-0.7 as well.
Great contribution for elasticsearch interpreter! This PR enables us to support ES 5.0 easily!

@jongyoul @felixcheung Could you help merge it into branch-0.7 and master ? CI failure is not relevant. 

```
Failed tests: 
  NotebookTest.testAbortParagraphStatusOnInterpreterRestart:760 expected:<ABORT> but was:<RUNNING>
WelcomePageSuite:
- Welcome sign is correct *** FAILED ***
  The code passed to eventually never returned normally. Attempted 19 times over 20.868011947 seconds. Last failure message: WelcomePageSuite.this.find("welcome")(WelcomePageSuite.this.driver).isDefined was false. (WelcomePageSuite.scala:31)
```
Any update on whether this might be merged soon?
fixed
Let me redo the PR and merge with the above remarks included
Merge if there is no more comment
CI was green I think https://travis-ci.org/apache/zeppelin/builds/189432940
Don't think CI errors are related to this PR.

@minahlee I updated and resolved another way.
When web application develop mode, the source base of production mode is different to web application develop mode. So, I updated to correct source base path for develop mode of web application.
@Leemoonsoo @jongyoul Please help review.
LGTM
LGTM
LGMT. I have a question. Is there any related issue to SparkInterpreter? Can you take a look into it?

@cloverhearts the failed test looks related this patch. Can you check it?

```
Failed tests: 
  NoteInterpreterLoaderTest.testNoteInterpreterCloseForAll:192 null
```
@1ambda Can you review this PR deeply?
Merge to master and branch-0.7
@jongyoul I checked SparkInterpreter, it has the same issue with context class loader
Thank you @khalidhuseynov
@AhyoungRyu Please help review
LGTM
LGTM

There is a flaky test in the result:

```
WelcomePageSuite
```

Never mind the result. that test is being fixed now. LGTM
@Leemoonsoo I think to wrap it with `ClassloaderInterpreter` would be a good idea. @DrIgor Can you try it on?

Is it ok to remove it?
LGTM. will merge it
LGTM

@jongyoul just wanted make sure the failure is coming from `WelcomePageSuite` it self, not as a side effect of other problems.

I'll close this PR and open another PR once i found fix.
I see.

Thanks

The bug is in:
`org.apache.zeppelin.helium.HeliumVisualizationFactory.installNodeAndNpm(HeliumVisualizationFactory.java:80)`
and is not related to the PR
LGTM!

Thank you for contribution but the `margin` affect also on the `report` mode. 
Could you solve the problem?

Thank you for contribution!.
please rebase PR and  
If you let us know about testing way on detail, it's easy to review.
